# Abstract

Here, I re-examine the analysis of Oeppen and Vaupel (2002).

The graph below provides insights into an enduring relationship between maximum Life Expectancy and birth year showing the increase in maximum life expectancy for each new generation.

# Analysis

```{r}
#| message: false
gapminder::gapminder_unfiltered  |> 
  group_by(year) |>
  filter(lifeExp == max(lifeExp)) |>
  ungroup() |>
  select(year, country, lifeExp) |>
  arrange(year) ->
  sumdat

sumdat |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = year, y = lifeExp)) +
  geom_point(aes(color = country)) +
  geom_point(pch = 1) +
  theme_bw() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) +
  xlab("Year") +
  ylab("Maximum Life Expectancy") +
  scale_color_discrete(name = "Country")
```

This is a lovely plot of life expectancies.
